author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: 1D star Liam Payne had 'meltdown' before cancelled show
text:
Eric Frazer/WireImage Liam Payne of One Direction performing in Foxboro, Massachusetts, last month. One Direction star Liam Payne had a “meltdown” before the pop group’s show was cancelled earlier this week, according to reports.
Fans were devastated after the foursome’s Belfast show was called off Tuesday night at short notice because Payne felt unwell.
Now an insider has said the “pressures of fame” caused the 22-year-old pop idol to suffer a panic attack.
"The pressures of fame and being on the road for two years have made Liam ill," a source told The Sun .
“He was devastated about letting everyone down, especially the fans, but he wasn’t physically able to get on stage. He had a complete meltdown.”
Liam Payne joins @OneDirection on stage in Belfast after prev gig cancelled
 https://t.co/0SgaIXvd8g #OneDirection pic.twitter.com/0VQ8JV866v
— Love Belfast ❤️ (@love_belfast) October 22, 2015 Payne had recovered enough to join the group on-stage on Wednesday night, much to the delight of their legion of fans.
The source said they believed the illness had been "brewing" for a while because of the group’s uncertainty in recent weeks.
The group are scheduled to take a break from touring and recording next year, after five years together.
On Wednesday morning, Payne apologized on Twitter to worried fans and said he felt bad for letting them down.
Christie Goodwin/Redferns One Direction - Harry Styles, Liam Payne, Niall Horan and Louis Tomlinson - performing in London in September 2015. "I'm so sorry to everybody I disappointed last night. I'm feeling better now. I really hope everyone can make the rescheduled date on Friday," he shared.
"Thank you so much for all the trends and lovely messages you guys did for me it really shows how amazing u guys actually are.
"As I said I'm feeling much better now and I really can't wait to perform and make it up to everyone later."
